description: Middle English chapiter, from Old French chapitre, from Latin capitulum, diminutive of caput (“head”). Doublet of chapter and capitulum.

entries.meaning: (architecture) The capital or uppermost part of a column, upon which the roof and its decorations are supported.
(UK, law, obsolete) A written summary of matters to be inquired of or presented before justices in eyre, or justices of assize, or of the peace, in their sessions; articles.
